title: Lack of care
body: Only 2 doctors that actually listen to you. Unfortunately one is no longer there and the other a locum. My experience with other doctors there is that they don't listen, talk over you and then fob you off. Far too many patients for them to deliver a good sevice.

title: Disconnected after 30min wait in queue!
body: Waited in a queue for 30min to book an appointment became 1st in queue and then disconnected after recorded voice saying that the practice is busy! Why allow me to wait 30min before doing this.

title: Good consultation
body: DOCTOR listened, gave good advice and asked me to follow up with her in a few weeks. I felt that she took my concern seriously and wasn't rushing to prescribe medication, which maybe unnecessary.

title: Not a good practice
body:
Worst practice I have been to. Some doctors are caring. Others are overbearing and pompous, making you feel you don’t understand your own symptoms and are dismissive. 
Receptionists do not listen and are abrupt. It seems they allocate 30 seconds to each call so you are cut off from speaking.
I have been late, once, for five minutes, calling to apologise, but was made to wait for one hour However, you can be made to wait to be seen for more than 40 minutes with no mention of why. I appreciate people have health problems and need to be dealt with but the whole practice is infected with unpleasantness.

title: FIVE STAR SERVICE *****
body: What a wonder full place, very clean and the staff very welcoming and professional, I was hesitant but was made very comfortable and settled. I had my right cataract removed and a new lens fitted, and throughout the procedure the consultant made me feel totally at ease. I am now looking forward to having my left eye done now. A Big thanks to the staff and the consultant.

title: 111 Amazing!
body: I rang up with a strange query and the person who answered my call was helpful and compassionate. After being passed on to another member of staff to support me medically I received the same excellent support. A really amazing service in a stressful time! Well done

title: Perfect experience.
body:
Mum recently passed away on ward 44. The care she, and us as family, were given was perfect. The team could not have been more caring, helpful, and sympathetic.. Without their help things in her last few days would have been so much harder.

My two sisters and myself would like to thank the whole team for everything they have done for us and our mum.

We cannot speak more highly of them. 

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts...

readBy.name: Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic Service
body: On the 02-July I went to A & E dept. with a retention problem & in severe discomfort From the moment I reported to A & E the service & care I received from the A & E staff & then the urology personnel in Hopkins ward was superb. The care & consideration from the medical personnel the porters, cleaning ladies & everybody else concerned with running that ward made the 24 hours absolutely stress free, the food was excellent. Thank you RBH & everybody who looked after me.

title: Friendly kind staff
body: As we couldn't have visitors the staff were like our family.  They were so kind and caring even though they were busy and tired from nursing Covid patients.  All staff worked with care and professionalism and treated us with respect and dignity.  I don't know a way round this but as a person with a hearing loss I found hearing people with masks on very difficult and had to speak to my GP afterwards to find out what had actually been said about my condition. It would have been helpful if when I was moved to a "green zone" on the Covid ward, because I had tested negative for Covid, this was explained to me.  It took me about 24 hours to realise that all the patients in my bay had tested negative for Covid.  A simple explanation would have been reassuring.  I was very impressed with the family liaison service allowing patients to "see" family on an Ipad. Hospital catering seems unaware of NHS dietary advice including recommended amounts of sugar, fat and salt. I never achieved more than 2 of my 5 a day fruit and veg and some days it was only one.   The positives far outweighed the negatives.  Well done for the care you are giving in these difficult times.  If you need to go to hospital, even if you end up on a Covid ward, rest assured you will be treated well and safely.

title: Simply the best
body: I went in for a TKR on 26th June, feeling quite anxious as things are currently quite different. I needn't have worried, this place is amazing! Right from entering the building I was made to feel relaxed and was talked through absolutely everything I needed to know. All the staff are so warm and friendly and cannot do enough for you. I cannot praise them all enough, from the people serving the teas, breakfast and lunches and the cleaners to the nurses and the surgeons, they are all worth their weight in gold.

title: Great Support
body: It seems like all you hear are negative comments regarding the NHS, but these troubled times have shown us all how much we rely on it, I would just like to say that I appreciate that I might have to wait on the phone a while and that those judged to be more urgent, serious or in greater need will get an appointment before me and I am fine with that because when my complaint has fallen into this criteria I have been seen before some one else. The service and support I have received from all levels of staff at the Emersons Green Medical Centre has been first class and that this support and service has covered a range of issues over the last couple of years; so I would just like to say THANK YOU.

title: Very Patient!
body:
I registered with this practice after moving and several recommendations by friends and family. I have been with Brighton Health and Wellbeing centre for 1 month and i have absolutely NOTHING but good things to say. 
I am currently going through my first private IVF treatment which involved me having to have blood tests carried out - the surgery and receptionists have been nothing but patient and gracious with me during what was a very stressful time personally and a very stressful time worldwide!
The nurse I've seen has also been so polite and kind to me.
Much better than any doctors surgery I've had in Brighton.
Thank you to all the staff for working so hard and being so sweet.

title: In praise of telephone appointments
body: Very quick response to my problem and I was spoken to within the day by a doctor via phone and prescriptions sent to my chosen pharmacy. Issue continued and was again dealt with on the same day by phone and I was given prescription. All sorted now. Thanks for expert care.

title: World class care
body:
It’s difficult to express in words my appreciation to the staff for looking after me following my  recent PE diagnosis but here goes..The doctors, nurses, porters and cleaning staff were all friendly, accommodating and extremely professional.
Not forgetting the little gracious lady who cheered me up with regular supplies of coffee, tea, biscuits, cake and fruit..
Excellent.
Thank you all so much!

title: Happy patient
body: In September 2018 I was admitted to Frimley after falling off my bike and breaking my femur . Almost 2 years on I am still experiencing pain and weakness in my right knee.  This causes me to walk very slowly and cautiously.   The hardest part is coming down stairs, however this has been made easier with the hand rails fitted to stairs.  I would like to thank the physiotherpy dept for organising the hand rails to be fitted to my property as I use them each and every day and allow me to travel up and down my stairs with confidence.  The guys placed the rails in 4 different positions and I would like to them them for their time by coming into my house and carrying out this work.

title: No need to be afraid !
body:
I was  sent via an urgent appointment from my GP and, in addition to fear over my condition I had the added worry of having to visit a hospital during the Covid19 outbreak.I put off seeking help for a number of weeks,as I was all too well aware of the pressure the NHS is under at the current time.Throughout June I had to visit a number of departments,so I speak with experience ,  despite the exceptional circumstances of the pandemic,  I was treat with the utmost kindness.I am likely to have to return to the hospital and when I do get my next appointment I shall not await it with the dread I felt the first time around.
If you are reading this and need to see a Dr but are putting it off because of the pandemic,please think again.There really is nothing to fear.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Efficient, professional and caring
body:
I received a diagnosis of needing a replacement ascending aorta on 21st April. Despite being initially told I would probably have to wait 4 - 5 months for the operation due to the impact of COVID-19 on the NHS, I was admitted to Ward 11 at UHCW just 9 weeks later, had my operation on 29th June and was discharged to recover at home within 6 days. I believe this was at least partly due to the strategy adopted at UHCW of having self contained resources required for my procedure within Dedicated wards on Green and Blue pathways to counter disruption to surgical procedures by the COVID-19 infection.
Whatever the reason, the layout of the unit was logical and the processes involved in my treatment were fast and efficiently delivered. The medical treatments and interventions were well explained and I found all the staff who looked after me during my stay caring, well informed, hard working and professional. 
The ability to do all this while also adopting the necessary precautions during COVID-19 was in my view quite remarkable.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Very hit and miss
body: I've been a patient here for over 20 years since I moved to the area.  It used to be awesome, absolutely 10/10 but over the years the regular doctors have reduced their hours more and more and now it's vitually impossible to get an appointment with a doctor who knows anything about you.  To be honest, getting any appointment is a nighmare.  They've introduced a few different online services, but there are never any appointments available on there (if the site actually works at all).  Appointment times are NEVER kept to and are at least 30 mins late all the time, yet if a patient is every a few mins late, reception make you feel like a criminal and that they are doing you an incredible favour by letting you still have the appointment (and you will still sit there for half an hour or more!).  I've even had the very first appointment in the morning, and then seen the doctor I'm seeing wander in from the carpark with their bags and coat long after my appointment time, and then taking another 15-20 mins to get ready to see me.  It's a total joke.  SOME of the reception staff are lovely, but some are just downright rude.

title: Neurology Outpatient Appointment Shambles part 2
body: I previously left a review on 24th June 2020, as I had received a letter canceling my Neurology Telephone Appointment, which was supposed to be at the beginning of July 2020. The letter I received was totally inappropriate. However, I thought I had sorted it all out and found out the reason why my appointment had been cancelled. Another Telephone Appointment was booked for a week after my origanal appointment, and I received an appointment letter confirming my new appointment date and time. Then to my great surprise, just as I was about to leave my house to go shopping, the telephone rang and it was my Neurology Consultant. They told me I was still on their list for my original cancelled appointment date, for a Telephone Appointment. What made it even more strange, was my original appointment was supposed to be in the morning and they rang me in the afternoon? As you can imagine, I was confused and hadn't prepared myself for this appointment with my Consultant. If they had rung me 5 minutes later, I would have left the house and wouldn't have been able to take their phone call. I feel something has gone very wrong with the Neurology appointments system and needs looking into urgently, to prevent the same thing from happening to someone else.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Delighted with my treatment
body: I spent 8 Days in hospital and I believe the team bottomed a health problem I have had for 7 years, I have been delighted with all the whole team have done for me. I have been kept in touch with everything that has been found and what they were going to do next, it’s been a very positive experience. I am now going back for blood tests and know that there further work to do but feel confident of a positive outcome.

title: Poor communication
body: If you have a friend or relative in Byron Ward you are unable to reach them, or ask how they are.  The phone service goes to a music playing option and then cuts you off.  This happens every time, no matter how many times you ring, or what time of day you ring.  Terrible, broken communication.  The hospital probably thinks it is doing a good job.

title: Superb service
body: Into A&E for bowel pain. Triaged in 10 minutes. Straight into General Surgery. Immediately seen by 2 doctors and booked in for minor surgical procedure as soon as allowed. Excellent, careful and thorough procedures, skilled practitioners and very friendly and reassuring.

title: Excellent care and attention
body: Recent day surgery at Hexham General. I cannot praise the whole team on Ward 3, as well as the surgical team highly enough. Excellent care and a very personal approach. They deserve every credit for the difficult work that they do.

title: Wonderful GP Practice
body:
What a wonderful surgery this practice is. Joined here a couple of years ago and no regrets. 
The doctors and receptionist are fantastic and always do their best to help you in any way they can.
So much confidence with this surgery and always carry out thorough examination and put your mind at ease. 
Excellent service keep up all the good work you do and thank you for the care you show.

title: Absolutely first class
body: During this extremely difficult time of Coronavirus, I had to attend UCLH for pre-assessment tests prior to a procedure under anaesthetic. I can’t begin to explain how wonderfully caring and professional the staff were throughout. I cannot praise them highly enough.

title: Excellent compassion and understanding
body: I visited the eye department from a referral from the opticians. I was extremely satisfied with my visit. The ophthalmologist was very understanding and took her time to listen thoroughly to my symptoms. The consultant who I saw afterwards was again very patient. He thought about everything very carefully and offered sound advice with clear explanations. I was very happy with the service I experienced.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant Care
body:
I attended the hospital initially through Accident and emergency, then endocrinology and then Gynaecology.
I have received fantastic care from this hospital, and i can not say Thank you enough.
Through out i was treated so well by all the staff and they made a difficult time so much easier to deal with by being so compassionate, because i was at times very frightened.
I had to come back to the hospital several times for scans and tests and every time i was given wonderful care, as well as very prompt treatment.
I am now back home recovering from surgery and so deeply thankful and grateful for all the dedicated work staff have put in on my behalf to bring about my return to good health.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body: The staff here are Excellent really helped me through covid 19. Keep up the excellent work.  You may have to wait a while when busy but they are working very hard to see everyone.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Efficient and Friendly
body: Great experience with LMP,  especially during the recent pandemic, I've been impressed with the speed and organisation of all staff and doctors. I was referred through to physio much quicker than I was expecting, no complaints at all. The video call consultation was super easy and quick to organise.

title: Thank you!
body: following a collapse whilst out running, I went to A&E and later a ward. The care and consideration from everyone was amazing. I was in a very fragile state , after a heart attack two years before.  Everyone I met was confident in what they were doing and I witnessed everyone being treated with kindness, consideration and respect.  Thank you everyone.

title: Very Disappointed
body:
I appreciate the Covid precautions,but found the staff member very rude and uninformed as she passed me the swab test through the half opened door which she  couldn’t wait to close in my face! Even though we were 2 meters apart. So I did the test in my car and returned straightaway. I was informed by her the results would be in a few days. 
Then a few days later I receive this msg
“Your swab was not processed in the lab because it wasn’t labelled correctly. I have left another swab in reception for you. Please write time & date when you do the swab on the bottle and the time & date on the form” Why wasn’t I informed of this from the start and why didn’t she fill out these details when I handed her it back!
Very unprofessional!!

title: Mixed reviews
body:
Whilst I find all the nurses to be caring and respectful, I find the consultant side to be almost non existent.
After waiting nearly 3 years for tests, I have now waited a further 16 months and 3 clinic cancellations for a follow up appointment to discuss the results (which is in a further 3 1/2 months time).
Meanwhile my condition has deteriorated and I will be asked my GP to book me into a out of district hospital and a real consultant who actually works.

title: Wonderful staff
body: I brought my mum to A&E on advice from 111, she is nearly 87 and has always been in good health but has recently become unwell, I think the whole Covid situation & lack of physical contact has taken its toll & manifested as physical symptoms. I have never been so worried about her. The staff, from the initial admitting nurse, through triage, the doctor examining her & the lovely mental health team, were absolutely fabulous. I can’t thank you enough. In these busy times, you treated mum with dignity, care & compassion & you deserve as much praise as possible. Thankyou again.

title: exceptional service during lockdown
body: My treatment was carried on regardless  through the lockdown period.  My great thanks go to all the staff at Maywood and Day Lewis pharmacy for their continued support during this difficult time.

title: Unprofessional staff, disappointing appointment…
body:
Unprofessional staff: 
Front-of-the house staff is extremely unprofessional (impolite  language, raised tone) and upon requests of support by patients. This includes on-the phone and reception service. For me, this makes my experiences at this surgery stressful. 

Disappointing appointment system:
The lack of appointments means it is difficult to see the same doctor each time, this lack of continuity in care is stressful too. It is almost impossible to book an appointment, unless you call at 8 am and while the line is blocked at this time due to the amount of callers - by the time you reach the reception, it is too late and all appointments are gone.

title: Great care, awful WiFi
body: Our child frequently has to spend days or weeks on end here for their cancer treatment and the care from the team is amazing. However as a family of four we are split during these times so it’s incredibly important to stay in regular contact. The WiFi, although it exists and is free, rarely allows you to connect and if it does, does not have enough bandwidth or stability to achieve the most basic of tasks, let allow a video call. In addition to this, some rooms are evidently so shielded from cellular reception that you can’t even make a phone call. This is very distressing when trying to communicate about the care of our child. We spend time in our local hospital in Peterborough and their WiFi by contrast is exemplary; I was even able to work remotely during a recent stay - so it is possible to solve.

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic out-of-hours service
body: Used the out-of-hours service as it was a Sunday. Got through really quickly, had my symptoms assessed and was rung back promptly by a local Practice Nurse. Antibiotics were prescribed which I was able to collect from local Boots immediately. All done in the space of about 1 hour from start to finish! Thank you very much.

title: Excellent care
body: Thank you all for the care and kindness shown to me on my admission. The combination of too much sun and alcohol proved foolish and I regret the trouble this caused. Your team proved very caring and I can not thank you enough.

title: Fantastic care
body: I was rushed to Royal Surrey with an acute throat infection requiring immediate  surgery. The level of professionalism and care received from my surgeon and the entire ENT team saw me through a scary procedure and resulting tracheostomy with minimal worry. Thanks are due also to the lovely nurses in Recovery who smiled through their PPE difficulties, and to all the staff on Clandon and Bramshott wards who helped get me home so quickly .  A thank you is just not enough to say how much all of you are valued especially in these difficult times.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: next of kin
body: my mother was admitted through a&e for what I now know was sepsis although at no point was this confirmed. A&E we brilliant and contacted me 3 times with updates, bloody marvellous but once she had left a&e for the wards I was never contacted wit updates on my mothers progress and was told on Wednesday 01.07 that they had been calling her next of kin, my father trying to give updates but no answer. there was no answer as my dad died almost 4 years ago. whilst I have no complaint about her treatment why when I had given the details to the paramedics that I was her next of kin, a&e had my details and called, the wards had different information. This was extremely upsetting no knowing what was going on and having to explain (whilst I was still upset over finding my mother on the floor of her home) that my dad had died no once, twice but 3 times before some lovely nurse updated your systems. mum was transferred from a&e to amu, to e8 and then d3 and no occasion was I informed, I had to find this all out for myself. I appreciate due to the current pandemic all that the nhs are going through, I have gladly stood on my doorstep and clapped every Thursday, but this error was simple and needn't have caused me further stress and upset of the not knowing what or where was going on

title: Great service
body:
I was referred to Dental Hospital by an emergency dentist for partial root canal treatment.I received the appointment and treatment within less than 24 hours of visiting the dental practice. Would like to thank to all the staff at the Dental Hospital (wish could name them) for being very caring,kind and extremely professional.
Thank you
Diana Nisterenkova-Chester

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: A wonderful service
body: I came into Ward F15 (which moved to F4 the day I left) on 29 June for a hernia repair, which had been postponed by the Covid crisis. Everything about the service, from the pre-op assessment, was carried out to the highest standards. On the ward, all the staff who looked after me did so with professionalism and care, as well as humanity. I was able to ask questions and discuss my case. I have only the highest praise for everybody involved, and would without hesitation recommend the service to anybody who needed it.

title: At Ease,
body: Big pat on the back to all the staff,,, made me feel much at ease,  very happy with the professional manner,, you do a wonderful job, Thank you 👍

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Such caring staff
body: We visited on 28 June as my 94 year old mum had a fall, badly cutting her arm. From the initial care, to her stitches, to us having to visit 3 times more for dressing changes (Still ongoing) they could not have been more caring..and I mean EVERYONE there. Thank you 😊

title: Great practical and emotional help
body: The nurses did everything they could, during a busy and difficult time on the ward, to ensure that my sister and I spent our Mum’s final hours with her in as much comfort as possible. They respected and protected our privacy but were on hand to help all the way. This was a distressing time for us but they were lovely, supportive and helpful. Thank you.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great  Phone Consultation
body:
I am very greatful for the consultation that took place via a phone call on a Sunday afternoon. 
The doctor concerned took the time to go through recent medical records and gave a full explanation of why the medication was prescribed and how to manage possible side effects.
They showed pure commitment and answered all queries and worries. 
Thank you Hall Green Health Centre

title: Brilliant service
body: I had breathing problems so had to go to a/e from the  nurse who took me straight to the main department then seeing a Male nurse and then seeing a nurse practitioner who was very helpful and did everything for me I would like to thank every single person who helped me then I was moved to ward 1 the staff on there were really brilliant and caring

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lack of social distancing in eye clinic
body: I have had to attend the emergency eye clinic twice in the last 4 weeks and on both occasions have been disappointed at the lack of social distancing. Okay, 3 out of every 4 seats are out of use but patients are queuing for reception right next to patients waiting for treatment in the red chairs. I took the only spare red chair and had somebody standing very close to me waiting for their turn at a busy and slow reception. Despite having an appointment on both occasions,  I waited over an hour before treatment in this worrying environment. I was also worried to see patients ignoring the stand behind lines at reception and even moving to the side of the perspex screen. Reception staff did nothing to ask patients to social distance. This needs addressing urgently.

readBy.name: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Care
body:
I was taken to A&E on  02/06/20 with excruciating back pain I couldn't move and was having spasms and pains down my leg I was in a terrible state, but u want to thank the paramedics the triage nurse the rest of the nurses and the doctors they could not have been more prompt 10 minutes after arriving a nurse came in with a mixture of pain relief and muscle relaxants to help me, 5 minutes later doctor came in examined me and sent me for X-Rays of my whole spine and pelvis (X-Ray staff were also brilliant too) orthopaedic doctor come to see me and sent me for a CT Scan all this happened within  1 1/2 hours, see doctor after looked at scan prescribed ne medications and wants and MRI Scan i cannot praise the staff enough for what you do you are all amazing kind caring people, thank you so very very much for the first class care.
Also like to mention was very good with cleaning and hand washing and trying to keep the hospital safe a great big 👍 up i am proud of my local hospital keep up good work everyone.

title: No compassion
body: No compassion for people with mental health issues, a few doctors were not very compassionate and understanding (there was 2 doctors that were understanding) We had to fight for the right treatment and medication.

title: Mixed Bag
body: I've been a patient for a few months and had 2 GPs who were a pleasure to deal with and two who were rude, dismissive and abrupt. The most recent experience was a GP deciding she knew better than a Consultant and changing my medication without even consulting me. I think it's a case of finding a good GP and only seeing that one cos the other ones you come away wishing you hadn't made contact.

title: Caring practice
body:
On Saturday early evening 4 July 2020 paramedics attended my home following a 999 call from my daughter. I had blacked out whilst seated causing considerable concern to my wife and daughter. The 999 operator gave calm, reassuring instruction pending the paramedics arrival. On regaining consciousness I and my family were relieved by their becalming review of events and examination of me. Although I was unwell once again in the ambulance i was heartened knowing I was in their hands. On arriving in a busy A and E  I was soon examined and transferred to bay 5 Firth 6 for overnight examination. During my one day stay there i spoke with the domestic staff ( cleaners and caterers) and all willingly and cheerfully chatted. The nurses were extremely helpful despite there being other more demanding patients. Last, but not least I want to thank the general medicine consultant and his colleague who gave me an insight into how, why and what happened to me. He gave me the awakening I needed to appreciate that actioning medical advice and non medical changes is necessary and achievable. 
At a time when the NHS and its staff face such considerable demands I want to thank you all for your care and attention. All the best.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Ward 23 my Nursing Heroes
body:
My short stay on ward 23 has imprinted in my memory a terrific family of nurses pulling together to make patents stay and my stay as good as possible. They worked so hard even in stressful situations kept smiling creating for me a comfortable and happy time. They were extremely busy yet no task or request was a problem. 
Special Thank you, to the nurses.
The food was excellent and thanks to kitchen staff and cleaners.
I thank the doctors and their teams for their help and advice 
So grateful and thankful to all
Paddy Ferguson

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good Practice
body:
I attended A&E by ambulance. The ambulance crew were efficient, kind and helpful. I have been to hospital on several occasions throughout my life and have always found the ambulance crew to be the same except on one occasion.
This Saturday the A&E staff were all kind and lovely people and I could not fault them in their approach. I felt safe and looked after by all of them. Unlike this instance, I did come up against some awful people on previous occasions but they can’t all be saints, I suppose. I wish the bad people could take a leaf out of the good people’s books though. It is luck of the draw who patients come up against unfortunately and this is shown by the various comments people have made. I have come up against real angel nurses and good doctors and most of them are kind people but the bad apples can give a patient a horrendous experience whilst in hospital. And I have experienced this myself and also another member of my family who unfortunately died. But I would like to say a big thank you to the staff on A&E on duty on Saturday mid day and afternoon of the 4 July 2020. I felt safe in their care and the doctor I saw could not have been any kinder, helpful or more compassionate than he was. I found all the nurses extremely kind, helpful and nothing was too
much trouble for them. So thank you to these members of staff. They are a credit to the NHS and can set an example to others who may not be so kind.

readBy.name: Milton Keynes University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Professional treatment - long waiting time.
body:
Greeted promptly and temperature checked. Unfortunately had to wait over 2 hours before being seen. Just unlucky but do recommend contacting department by telephone before visiting if possible.
Totally worth the wait and I appreciated the apology given. My treatment was efficient and  professional. Thankyou.
There are signs for parking but unable to find the site. Parked on a side road.

author: A first time mom
title: Bitter postnatal care experience
body:
I had my first and only baby at the end of Aug,2018 via an emergency c-section . Was fortunate enough to have the care of some efficient doctors and wonderful compassionate midwives throughout the whole labor period till birth .I could not thank them enough. However some bitter experience during the postnatal care period almost ruined my birth experience.  
It was in the postnatal maternity ward that the behavior of 2 senior staff members shocked me to the core. One of them constantly pressuring me to breastfeed and judging me when I had to formula feed due to lack of milk supply in the initial days after birth.  
The day after giving birth as i was headed for the first bath i simply asked them if i can get a towel since i cant find mine?In response they sarcastically asked whether I wanted toiletries as well, saying they had none of those either. Not to mention being highly irritated when i asked some basic questions about baby care or if I needed anything, ignoring my need for expressing bottle at times. The next staff member was equally rude, shouting at me for not breastfeeding properly and also complained to my husband behind my back that I was not breastfeeding my baby when other midwives were not around! Even threatening him that I would not be discharged till I was able to breastfeed properly! Such behaviors in the initial days of a first time new mother is enough to make her depressed and hinder the bonding process with a new baby. Even now when I have successfully breastfed and raising my beautiful baby, thinking of the postnatal period makes me sad.  
Hope this feedback helps the postnatal care for new mothers recovering from difficult surgery, being treated with more kindness and compassion. Please ensure proper postnatal care as it is an important phase of a mother’s life and it’s crucial new mothers start off life happy with a newborn.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Burns16577
title: Stent in my ureter tube
body:
I had an operation 8 weeks ago to remove a stone which was stuck in the ureter tube, had a stent put in the tube to try flush out fragments that had gone back in, I got a patients copy letter when I left hospital and it says I was booked back in 3 weeks, its now been 8 weeks and still heard nothing.  
I have phoned my gp for appointment as its getting sore, and cant get an appointment for 3 weeks, also phoned the monklands to speak to someone in ward 6, who have passed me about 3 times.  
I have called to see about getting stent out, they all said they would email the consultant, but in last 3 weeks heard nothing. Im hearing stories about if stent is in too long it is harder to remove and will cause more damage, I fully appreciate that things are hectic due to what is going on at the moment, but could someone please contact me at least

author: Bob26
title: Maternity hospital staff amazing but not so in the community team
body:
I had my baby 1 year ago, firstly I want to say the staff in the labour ward were fantastic. My waters went 3 weeks early, and I had to be induced. The midwife who helped with delivery was amazing, and I felt fully supported even when things didn't go to plan and I needed intervention to get my baby out quickly.  
Sadly, my experience of the community team was anything but nice. I was initially placed with the central team who were lovely, but then it was realized that due to my address I should have been under the North team. I then struggled to ever get hold of a midwife, they NEVER answered the phones, rarely called me back despite leaving numerous messages. I had an appointment at 36 weeks, where I wanted to discuss my birth plan as I had some questions. The answers I received to questions about monitoring the baby etc was ask the midwife, I don't know, they do it the same as us with a Doppler (they don't, they use completely different machines and I ended up with a probe being attached to babies head in an emergency!). I was told it was too soon to discuss my birth plan and to discuss it when I was seen at 39 weeks. I never got to this point as my waters went 3 days later!  
I was appalled by the North team community midwife, and feel I wasn't given any support and the appointments were purely a tickbox exercise for them rather than actually assessing me or my baby. I felt this midwife really didn't care at all, and I do not feel her knowledge of labour and birth were actually up to date.  
To end on a high, after my baby was born we were kept in over night. there was a HCA, she did bank and was a student nurse. Overnight I was exhausted with a baby who wouldn't stop screaming, she took my baby off me, cuddled her for an hour to let me sleep. She was my saviour after a tricky and long 4 days.  
If I ever have another baby, I am not sure I would use Croydon again, but this is simply because of the community midwife rather than the hospital staff as they were all knowledgeable, polite, personable and generally lovely!

author: Townsend
title: Grandchild with coronavirus symptoms
body:
20 month baby sent home from nursery with temperature, mum phones nhs 111 and advices to contact gp, who says will not see child but to self isolate with others that live in house.  
The next day child developers a rash - mum phones nhs 111 again and said a doctor would call back. Doctor calls and advises hospital. Attended hospital water sample taken says child has tonsillitis and ear infection, other child has now a rash but they would not test for covid 19. Has been advised to still isolate as has symptoms but refused to test.

author: Only Asking
title: Why not go contactless
body:
Due to my wife's condition I have been picking up her medication from various pharmacies in our local area. Some pharmacies don't ask for a signature as they are trying to be contactless and merely request verification by asking questions. In the current pandemic climate when asked to sign I've always declined and this has been accepted, until today.  
Given the pen attached to the desk is being used continually through-out the day and the piece of paper handed to you is used by all who sign, (worse still is when you're handed an old cardboard clip-bored with several pieces of paper attached) surely this is a possible source of cross contamination?  
Despite previously supplying the medication when I'd requested not to sign for the reasons given above, General Pharmacy at Wishaw would not issue medication unless I signed their sheet today. I could have wiped the pen down but I don't think they would have been pleased if I'd sprayed the piece of paper with the anti-bacteria spay available.  
Why not go contactless, ask more question at point of uplift or even use a safe-word to verify the person collecting the drugs is authorised.  
We're being asked to socially distance, time to move with the times and modernise.

author: valentino
title: I am not a victim of addiction I am a survivor
body:
I started to drink at a very young age, I loved the buzz and confidence it gave me. As the years went by my drinking became out of control .I got married and had two lovely boys but that still wasnt enough I was waking up shaking sweating I started to blackout I was glad about them as i didnt want to remember about my behaviour. Nobody wanted to be around me, I lost my family and my two beautiful boys.  
My drinking then became out of control I started to have seizures. I knew I had to do something my doctor referred me to CGL HALTON I have never looked back,they made me feel so welcome .I started to get involved in all activities days out Smart Meetings, Yes there was times when I relapsed but I was always welcomed back with open arms. I was never judged.  
My turning point was last year I started to get involved in the gardens at CGL HALTON. This was what I needed I knew I was getting well, for me recovery is one day at a time. I am now a Volunteer and Smart facilitator. A massive thank you to all staff who stood by by side thankyou from the bottom of my heart.  
Jodie my line manager who got me through my darkest days and was only a phone call away when Covid appeared. She got me back down to CGL and helped me get my well being and confidence back. I tell myself everyday I am not a victim of addiction I am a survivor.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: G-Han
title: Fife forensic psychiatry
body: My partner is supposed to be getting looked after by the community forensic psychiatry team. He’s worried about going out the house anyways but the virus has made him worse. The doctor knows how bad he is but won’t come see him at home, but trying to make him go to an appointment. Won’t listen to him & talks over him & forgets what he’s already told them. He said he really doesn’t like his treatment, but can’t say so cos he’s scared.

author: DouglasW
title: The care I received was outstanding
body: I attended A&E at QEUH Glasgow and was admitted to ARU3 with hepatitis and gastroenterological problem. It made me feel particularly miserable but the care I received was outstanding. Every single member of the team: reception, cleaners, porters, auxiliary, diagnostic, nursing and medical did their very best for me. There was absolutely nothing that could be criticised about any aspect of my stay in hospital despite it being very busy. Thank you all.

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Stan80
title: Alcohol addiction
body: Go to talk about my week and how I am feeling, what I am doing about my addiction. Got some good advice from listening to other peoples stories and really feel the group is beneficial.

author: Service uaer
title: Alcohol misuse
body: I lost my children due to my alcohol misuse on a temporary basis, it breaks my heart for putting them through this ordeal as it's not their fault and they do not understand why they can't be at their own home with their mummy. The group work and one-to-one sessions are good.

author: june11
title: Worried by the long wait
body: I had two skin biopsies done in nov 2019, I got result just before covid 19 hit, I've got bowens disease and basal cell carcinoma which seems to be getting worse, I'm awaiting app to discuss treatments, how long am I likely to wait, I do understand NHS is under tremendous pressure but I'm getting bit worried by the long wait.

author: SHANADOG
title: Too long to wait in these circumstances
body: On 12 June I dislocated my replacement hip. The pain was excruciating. I called for an emergency ambulance and was told it would be quick. The ambulance arrived almost 3 hours later. The paramedics were excellent and dealt efficiently and sympathetically. Once the ambulance arrived my treatment was perfect. The ambulance crew stayed with me till I was handed over in A&E. I was attended to very quickly. I felt reassured by the staff and their calmness. The doctor who attended me was with me throughout the journey and continuity of care was excellent. I was admitted overnight and discharged the next day. I was seen by a physiotherapist and given aids to use at home. Once home the memory of the experience fades but I can still recall the pain and accompanying panic while waiting for the ambulance. I feel 3 hours is too long to wait in these circumstances. Having said that I appreciate the time spent on me and all the other cases attended to that day.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: Jojo12
title: Alcohol dependence
body: The group are really accepting and make me feel welcome without judgement. I think it’s definitely the first steps in helping stop completely and I feel confident with the help and support I can achieve this all be it slowly!

author: Gratefuldaughter15
title: Fantastic remote assessment
body:
My Dad recently had a remote assessment with Dr Sitaram following his first seizure. The appointment was fantastic. The Dr took his time to speak to Dad and Mum making sure he had a full and accurate picture of Dad's presentation and health history. Indeed his skills were such that we were able to unearth aspects of our family history previously not considered relevant by ourselves.  
His manner was lovely, reassuring and very patient. He gave Dad a thorough and comprehensive explanation of his potential diagnosis, proposed further investigations and treatment plan.As a hearing aid user Dad was anxious about being able to hear so had asked myself to sit in on the consultation but Dr Sitaram's excellent communication skills meant I was not needed.  
At Dad's request we wanted to thank Dr Sitaram and Graham for their time and work arranging this appointment, it has been so reassuring and Dad feels much better knowing that driving may again may be in his future.  
Thank you again for your time, compassion and understanding. As a regional service the challenges facing neurology are significant and it speaks to the professionalism and dedication of the staff that at no point has Dad felt like a number or statistic.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: sem2011
title: Visiting A&E
body:
My son had a swollen and sore foot and after calling NHS 24, we were advised to attend A&E. I was apprehensive as haven't been anywhere near Hospital since changes have been made due to Covid. From the minute we were met by staff at main entrance taking our temperature right through to A&E staff everyone was friendly, talkative and reassuring. This really helped as all staff were wearing masks which could have been intimidating to a five year old, he was also wearing one, however, he took it in his stride.  
The Doctor and Nurses we met with as well as X-Ray staff were friendly and reassuring and chatted through what was going on at all times. This really helped, especially when taking blood from my son who had never had this done before. Thank you!

author: Pamela249
title: My poorly daughter
body: My toddler daughter became very unwell, she had a high temperature and wasn't eating or keeping anything down. I phoned NHS 24 and the lady that I spoke to told me that because she has a temperature she will have to isolate for 7 days and the covid team would be in touch. After that the covid team phoned, asking why I requested a callback if I didn't think my daughter had COVID 19, after telling the call handler on the phone that it wasn't the covid team I wanted to speak to, he continued to laugh. He told me and my daughter to isolate. I wasn't happy with this as I knew my daughter was seriously unwell, I phoned my local hospital and they advised to phone NHS 24 and demand to see a doctor. 6 phone calls later and I finally got put through to the local on call doctor who reassured me it couldn't be covid and said to take my daughter in within an hour if her temperature wasn't down. An hour later the local doctor phoned me back to see how my daughter was, I explained that the temperature was still the same and he asked for her to be brought into A& E. Upon arriving at A& E the Doctor was waiting for us, he checked my daughter over and seen there was a sign of infection and also a reaction to her 1 year jags. I am very, very grateful for my local NHS hospital and cannot thank them enough.

author: bellajem89
title: My Birth Experience
body:
I wanted to say thank you to the Midwives and Doctors who took such amazing care of us leading up to the birth and then also during our stay at Raigmore Hospital to bring our precious little girl safely into the world amidst a pandemic nonetheless.  
I get emotional typing this because I honestly have so much respect and appreciation for these people.The doctors, but particularly the midwives who we were blessed with could not have been any more caring, loving, patient , understanding, respectful or professional if they tried. I would pick them every single time without a moments hesitation.  
I went in to hospital feeling like the whole experience would  
pretty much leave me with very little dignity as you do. I couldn't have been more wrong. I have come home feeling empowered and strong and capable with the confidence that I am equipped with everything I need to be successful at being a new mum and it's all because I received and continue to receive the most amazing support from these angels.  
There are not enough things I could say to articulate the gratitude I have for you and what you did for us.  
Thank you from all 3 of us !

author: Roast Chicken
title: Recovery from substance addiction
body:
I relapsed into heroin use after years being clean. I referred myself to the service and began the long road to being clean again with weekly sessions seeing my worker Sharon and collecting my prescribed medicine from my local pharmacy. All the professionals involved treated me with humanity and respect and made the journey not only bearable but actually enjoyable and life affirming - helping me to see the emptiness that drugs bring and the value of human care.
The covid pandemic meant I had to finish my treatment remotely (thankfully no Zoom though! ) but the provision continued and I am now clean again, which is how I intend to stay.

author: tiddles2
title: All very nice and professional
body: This is to all the doctor's nurses and surgeons and all the carers and staff that looked after me when I had a cardiac arrest in September 2019 after I had a problem with my bowel and had an emergency op then had a bag fitted, It took twenty minutes to get me going again, this was after having op for a aneurism. I was in intensive ward for about 3 week's so would once again say a massive thank you to each and everyone at Musgrove also Barrington ward for putting up with me, thank's again, you kept me alive, maybe the carer's will remember me they were all very nice and professional.

author: eh2020
title: Immediately put me at ease
body: I was recently referred to the hysteroscopy clinic at Boston Pilgrim hospital. The staff there were first class explained everything and immediately put me at ease. I was quite worried about this appointment but there was no need it was quick and relatively painless which was due to the excellent staff.

author: Austinseven
title: They were all fantastic
body: I was suffering from chest pain so took myself to A& E. From thereon I was in the hands of marvelous team of consultants, nurses and ward staff. Everything was explained to me about my treatment which was to be the fitting of a pacemaker. I want to Express my thanks to the triage nurses, the consultants in the cardiac unit, the staff of Sapphire ward and also all the staff on Nelson ward. I won't pick out anyone in particular as they were all fantastic. Just a big thank you to you all.

author: Casryan29
title: fantastic physio team who kept me motivated
body: After being in hospital for almost 3 months with covid 19, and a multitude of complication including being in a coma and ventilated for 6 weeks, I woke up with a trachea and unable to move, talk, eat or walk.. The physio team at the Royal jubilee and most importantly at Glasgow Royal Infirmary were superb. The physio team assigned to myself were fantastic in their manner to ensure that I continued to be motivated and worked hard to get home, whenever I felt low or unable they kept my mood up by using positive reinforcement's, this ensuring within 3 weeks I went from sitting to being able to walk with a 3 wheeled frame. My physio continues at home and I still carry the motivation that was instilled on me by both hospitals teams. When I am tired I say to myself the mantra of my team which is simply 'I've got this'.

readBy.name: University of Glasgow - School of Medicine, Dentistry and Nursing

author: Purplegiraffe
title: More questions than answers
body:
I had my phone call review appointment with gynaecology last week.  
I answered the call to be told they were unsure why I had been referred by my GP as the procedure I had done at the end of the year was related to my appendix nothing gynae, my review was also not with the consultant who had seen me in hospital, who’s name I was unaware of as I was discharged under the care of the surgical ward, but who’s name I would like to know. I was due to be seen 4 weeks post discharge but wasn’t put on the review list so am only now being seen 7 months later. I ended the phone call with more questions than answers and extremely dissatisfied with the care I received.

author: Sithean
title: Felt abandoned by CAMHS
body:
After a long struggle to access help from CAMHS services for our daughter (helped to a great extent by a previous posting in Care Opinion) we received support on and off for a 4 -year period. This included child psychotherapy and some family intervention. We initially felt well supported by an excellent family therapist/case manager who sadly left the team. Since then our experience of this team has been poor and we now feel to a large extent abandoned.  
After completion of psychotherapy with mixed results it was decided the best course of action was to complete a new series of assessments. This process started in Aug 2018 and involved a series of meetings for our daughter and ourselves with various clinicians over a long period of time. We also gathered input from our daughter’s school and observations were carried out. Completing these assessments was a significant undertaking, and at times pretty disorientating for our daughter. The process started 21 months ago, and while we were given the results of two assessments we await the outcome of two important assessments which were completed in December 2019. We find this completely unacceptable. We have since phoned the centre repeatedly to ask for information about the outcome of the two remaining assessments and what support might be available to us. We have spoken with a variety of receptionists who have listened patiently to our concerns and promised to pass them on to relevant clinicians who, they assured us, will get back to us. Sadly, despite these repeated efforts we have been ignored and have been left with no alternative than to try other approaches including sharing these experiences here and making a formal complaint (to which we have had no response). It is vital we know the outcome of these assessments as our daughter is at a crucial stage of her life journey. We understand this team are under huge pressure and that they are badly understaffed but it doesn’t seem too much to ask that someone have the courtesy to return our calls and to let us know what is happening – even if just to give some idea of timescales. We hope this posting helps raise awareness of the situation in some Scottish CAMHS services and might in small way lead to improved experiences for our young people and their families.

title: Not helpful
body: My mum has very bad mental health and after 2 years trying to get on there system for support, numerous GP referrals my mum final was able to recivee help which was a support worker to take her out once a week, because of the pandemic this was unable to happen so after 6 weeks of a few phone calls to mum they have discharged her, they feel they have done there part.  My mum is now very upset after being dumped by canvediah house yet again after a 2 year battle to get her some help, so I now have to pick up the pieces when I am not well myself.  The amount of stress this is causing, she should be getting other support not just a few phonecalls she is a vulnerable person who has not been left on her own.

title: Disappointing FND Service
body: I am so disappointed that the FND service is under funded, and lacks any/regular therapy input (as recommended by FND Specialist neurologist Prof Stone, based at his Edinburgh FND service).  This is a condition that has the potential for improvement and reversibility with specialist input! In turn, this could allow people to get off benefits, work, have better quality of life. Yet, the 'outstanding' Walton centre does not offer a comprehensive service.  If some other hospitals can offer FND in and out patient therapy, then why can't this specialist hospital? I suspect part of the problem is funding but also support within the hospital  itself, for such a service. Sadly, FND patients are frequently misunderstood, discharged and left to get on with it. I hope the FND service can grow into something more substantial and effective but  I'm not holding my breath.

readBy.name: The Walton Centre NHS Foundation Trust

title: NOT IMPRESSED
body: I was bitten by my dog yesterday and rang 111 for assistance.  They were very thorough and made an appointment at Dunstable Health Centre.  I went there and was told by the Doctor that I had to have a tetanus booster although I had my last vaccination in 2012 and so I should go to A&E.  At A&E I was sent to the urgent GP dept.  All this time I was exposed to people not wearing masks at the L&D both staff and patients.  The urgent GP told me I did not need a tetanus booster and gave me antibiotics.  So I could have actually been treated at the Dunstable Health Centre and not have to put myself at risk of going to the L&D to be confronted with staff who were wearing scrubs but not masks.  Whomever the doctor was at the Health Centre clearly did not have the skills to treat me.   Very disappointing and now I am worried that I have been exposed to Covid-19 when I have barely been of my house since the lockdown started as my mother is shielding.

title: Excellent, helpful, friendly staff.
body:
Recently, I have been off work suffering from PMR.  I just want to say a massive big thank you to all the staff at NHMC who have helped to arrange phone consultations with the doctor, blood test on site with the nurse and also helping me with any queries I have had.
Each time I have recently had to contact NHMC either by phone or in person, I have always been greeted with a warm, friendly voice or face.  
Again, Thank you.

title: New virtual GP
body:
I always found it really stressful trying to get a GP appointment.
Today I rang for an appointment for my daughter. A GP rang me back with 15 minutes and asked me to send some pictures via a link he sent to my phone. I uploaded the photos, the GP rang me back and we have a prescription waiting for us at our designated pharmacy. This was all within an hour. No visit to the doctors required... please keep this service post COVID-19.

title: Great practice
body:
I had an endoscope investigation which wasn’t completely clear and was offered another 8 days later which was very reassuring.
Both teams involved were thoughtful, kind and professional. 
Lovely people. Thank you

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: A grateful patient
body:
During the Covid-19 pandemic I suffered from burns to my back.  At no stage was I made to feel a nuisance or a time waster, despite the rigorous infection controls.  The nurses who treated me on a regular basis were lovely and kind as was the doctor who prescribed ABs.  
I am very grateful to everyone at Rydal.

title: World class practice - amazing team
body: HGP are consistently excellent in their delivery of services - the GPs are knowledgeable, flexible, patient and kind. The nursing team are helpful, expert and friendly. The reception team work incredibly hard to assist however they can. Overall they support each other, are a respectable team and I always feel very well looked after and very grateful for their help. Particularly during the covid 19 situation they have still been accessible and helpful - they have looked at photos of a skin complaint, carried out child immunisations, wound care and I’ve been so impressed and grateful for their kindness.

title: top attention
body: appointment with ent ran on time with skilled attention and referral to Spire for mri sinus scan. Follow up after has been just like private  treatment. DHC is well run and credit to the practices responsible for administration

title: Fantastic service.
body: I find the staff here really friendly, and the doctors very kind. One GP in particular is always very thorough, calling me at home to ensure I'd followed advice. The receptionists will try really hard to get you an appointment, and there is an early morning walk in service if you need an urgent appointment.

title: Be prepared for over 2 hr wait for bloods
body: Not happy at all  0ver 2 hrs waiting for blood test got to the hospital 15 minutes before opening this has nothing to do with Covid , all the same nurses  everything the same apart from the queuing system outside. We need less chatting more action needed for this hospital to survive , not fair for anyone to have to wait that long for a blood test .   This is certainly not good for the older population or those of us with invisible disabilities  .

title: Great Care and Treatment
body:
I would like to thank the team in general.At my lowest when I pushed everyone away,they never gave up they still gave me my Independence but at the same time made sure I was supported.The team have been excellent making sure when I was poorly I got the right care and support and treatment even though I might off felt down and not wanting the treatment everything everyone did was in my best interest.When I was worried and went into hospital they still made sure I wasn’t left homeless and kept
My flat in which I worked so hard for and still have.The team have always made sure I have all the care in which they can provide and have gone the extra mile to make sure I feel
Protected and safe while still
Letting me have my independence and going to college and learning to drive.I would
Highly recommended this team to anyone out there who needs the help and care with there mental health however hard it feels there is people out there who want to support patients and there families to let them lead the life they want without the daily distress and anxiety.I would like to say a massive thank you to you all and hope that you all continue to provide me and others with the great standard of care and that others feel able to take that step and I hope this message lets others know that it is possible even in down moment to take that step to better life.Thank you to you all.:)

title: Great service
body: Really impressed with the service given by the Doctor and the team! The receptionist are very friendly and helpful. Thank you!

title: Frustrating
body: My son was telephoned on Friday telling him to take his 5 year old daughter with leukaemia for an ultrasound on the following Monday. He was not told it was to be at RSH. He even asked if it was on B level near the restaurant and the person agreed with him. As he has always attended the General he had no idea it was at RSH. I arrived with my granddaughter at the General. My other son had dropped us off. I was then told it was at RSH. I had to recall my son to collect us and take us to RSH. What a palaver. The person making appointments without giving paperwork should ensure that the patient is aware of the correct hospital. My granddaughter was very distressed by the fiasco. She hates having ultrasounds at the best of times!

title: Not a great practice
body:
It is extremely hard to get through on the phone to book an appointment (wait times of over 45 minutes). The online system is not able to book appointments, there is no benefit to using the online system! The reception staff are unfriendly and unhelpful. The practice itself is dimly lit and not a pleasant area to be in.
It is difficult to book an appointment that works around a 9-5 job.

title: Great care received
body:
I wanted to pass on my thanks to the reception staff and GPs for their support over the last couple of months. I have been really unwell and have been treated with kindness and professionalism during this very challenging time for everyone.
Particular thanks to the locum GP who has been thorough and thoughtful in their care throughout. I am very grateful and do hope Higham Hill reemploy them as they are excellent.

title: Extremely bad experience
body:
I have had joint issues since the age off 5, I have been passed from department to department,
Had both my knee and hip operated on and still have no answers to what is wrong with me, they say I am extremely hypermobile but also have a rhumatroid factor with in my bloods but arnt doing anything about it, I had an appointment over a year ago and was told that I would get another appointment which I never did, my health as got worse to were I ended up in hospital and they said they thought I had Siatica.  I haven't heard anything from the rheumatology department since.. my health and joints are only getting weaker. I'm getting no answer what so ever. Iv tried to contact them multiply times and no answer. I feel no one is talking me serious and haven't for the 18 year I have suffered with this illness.

title: Rude receptionist
body: I just rang the surgery to order my prescription the noise of the staff talking about personal lifes in the background stopped the receptionist from hearing which medication I was ordering, so i just pointed out that if people were not talking so loud in the background she would be able to hear me it was not a critisisam of her however she said with a raised voice do not speak to me like that i feel she was extremely rude to me.

title: Good Clinical Staff, The Rest Needs Addressing
body:
Pros - good caring staff, prompt service, choice given in my care, I was valued and listened to, MAU very clean.
Cons - 3 members of staff using public womens toilets and didnt report someone had done a giant jobbie and left it, 3 people sat in reception on the seats behind a board that says patients only (this means the heavily pregnant have to wait outside if we want to social distance and they say chivalry is dead), clamp down on people smoking outside maternity. Saw a mother crouching down next to a toddler having a fag right outside the entrance with members of staff walking past.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Best Service
body:
1) At the Entry, Staff has provided me with A) Hand Sanitiser  & B) Face Mask Disposable.

2) I left for my Diabetic Blood test and was successfully completed my activity in less than 30 minutes.

3) As per their instructions by 03rd business day, test results were received to my GP which is simply awesome 

Regards,
Sri Naveen Dasari

title: Superb treatment by all staff
body: My sincere thanks to all the team in Endoscopy who treated me with such superb care this morning during treatment.  They were all so very caring, friendly and professional.  XX
